basics.name: Albert Einstein
basics.label: Generalist Engineer
basics.summary: A ML expert, looking for the next challenge in life!

work.name: University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
work.summary: Conducting research in the field of machine learning and teaching undergraduate and graduate students in the field of mechanical engineering and machine learning.
highlights: Engineered a robust multi-modal ML framework for real-world application, significantly enhancing system deployment readiness.
Implemented denoising algorithms & generated data to boost detection accuracy and model reliability in diverse environments.
Advanced sensor fusion methodologies to optimize data quality for ML processing, markedly improving detection performance.
Created data pipelines and engineered features robust to environmental disturbances, yielding improved model performance.
Managed participant recruitment, coordination, & collection of clinical experiments, ensuring well-labeled & accurate datasets.
Led a team of 30 graduate and undergraduate students, mentoring, coordinating, and evaluating.

work.name: Joint Center of Excellence at KACST and Stanford University
work.summary: Experimental research on flight dynamics to aid in stall and spin detection and recovery.
highlights: Spearheaded the design and optimization of bespoke subscale aircraft test beds, significantly advancing stall-spin (SS) research through the integration of advanced signal processing, sensor fusion, and machine learning flight classification algorithms.
Enhanced stall and spin prediction models with innovative sensor fusion, denoising, and machine learning classification algorithms.
Optimized Data Acquisition system, & data management to increase operational flight-testing efficiency.
Engineered a novel fail-safe SS detection controller using predictive analytics, setting new standards in SS prediction and recovery systems, contributing to advancing aerospace safety protocols.
Created novel methodologies to evaluate airflow conditions and characteristics through hardware and software design.

work.name: SABIC
highlights: Pioneered the use of data mining to provide insights, significantly improving productivity and reliability metrics.
Provided critical engineering support globally, enhancing productivity across 90 affiliates.
Led the revamp of engineering SOPs, streamlining procedures across SABIC's global operations.
Spearheaded lean manufacturing initiatives, improving production records by 15% and operational efficiency by 12%.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

publications.name: Review of Machine Learning Methods for Anxiety Detection
Assessing Impact of Environmental noise on Anxiety Detection
Advancing Anxiety Detection: Efficacy of Machine Learning Models in Real-World
Feasibility of VR in Eliciting Anxiety in Older Women.
In-flight measurement of wing surface pressures on UAV during stall/spin maneuvers

project highlights.name: Quantum Computing
project highlights.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
highlights: Quantum Teleportation
Quantum Cryptography

project highlights.name: NanoGPT chatbot
project highlights.summary: Created a generative pretrained transformer gpt3-based chatbot. Based on Andrej Karpathy implementation. Trained on Shakespeare writings, it generates conversation based on user prompt.
highlights: Generative AI
Natural Language Processing

project highlights.name: GANs Image generator and CNN explainer
project highlights.summary: Created a discriminator/generator GAN pair on the CIFAR10 datasets, for synthetic image generation to maximize class output scores or highlight specific features, utilizing it as an explainability method for CNNs.
highlights: Generative AI
Explainability

project highlights.name: RL-based glider pilot
project highlights.summary: Created a OpenAI gym environment that is a simulation of flight mechanics. Implemented a SARSA RL to learn to navigate turbulent environment to maximize flight path. Implementation based on Reddy et al.’s “Glider Soaring via RL in the field.”
highlights: Reinforcement Learning
OpenAI Gym
